result.execSummary:
The defendant Maxwell D Matter was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).
  • OWI (2nd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: May transfer probation to Racine County.

miscConds.notes: Cash bail applied to costs, paid in full.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered. Sign releases. Inform agent of all prescriptions.
Expunction is conditionally granted (ON COUNT 1 ONLY) upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.

Not to use or operate a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license. Provide DNA Specimen unless previously obtained. Surcharge is imposed. Maintain employment and/or school combination. Follow through with any treatment or counseling recommended by agent. 
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

supervisions.notes: Cash bail applied to fine. Balance to be paid as a condition of probation on Count 1.

Reimbursement for Blood Draw costs to be paid/forwarded to Waukesha Co Clerk of Courts for Waukesha County Sheriff's Dept. Transcript fee to be forwarded to Waukesha County District Attorney's office. Cash bail applied to costs, paid in full.
Huber, with standard release conditions. Sentence credit of 2 days were granted. May transfer to Racine County.
Ignition Interlock to be installed on every vehicle OPERATED, TITLED OR REGISTERED to the defendant.

Perform Alcohol Assessment. 
*ATTEND the Victim Impact Panel meeting during the period of probation. If one is not available in Racine County, must attend the one in Waukesha County. To serve 30 days Huber, consecutive as penalty for non-attendance.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Maxwell D Matter

records.addlTxt: Wis. Dept. of Corrections notice of case status change received.  Outstanding financial obligations have been converted to a civil judgment.

Notice of Case Status Change - Defendant was Discharged from Probation/Extended Supervision
Balance error from DOC. Did not think they were DOC collect.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: ON COUNT 1 ONLY

Defendant Maxwell D Matter in court with Attorney Christopher Scott Carson.  Andrea M Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for sentencing hearing.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Carson makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:  WITHHELD SENTENCE:   

TERM OF PROBATION:  2 YEARS   **Transfer allowed to Racine County**

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  
____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
____No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia 
____No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
____Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are 
prescribed/sign releases.
____Inform Agent of all prescriptions
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
____Not to use or operate a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license
____DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done 

COSTS:  $268.00 & $250.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid as a condition of probation)

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.

**Expunction is conditionally granted (Count #1 ONLY) upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.**

 
COUNT #2:  HUBER:  60 days (2 days credit), Huber with standard release conditions.  Defendant to report to Huber facility by 5:00 p.m. on 6/8/16.  Transfer allowed to Racine County. 

FINE: $1,229.00 (to be paid out of cash bail posted ($1,000.00) and remainder due as a condition of probation on Count #1)

BLOOD DRAW FEE:  $35.00 paid through Waukesha County Circuit Court to be forward to Waukesha County Sheriff's Department (Due as condition of probation on Count #1) 

TRANSCRIPT FEE:  $8.00 paid through Waukesha County Circuit Court to be forwarded to District Attorney's Office (Due as condition of probation on Count #1) 

DL REVOCATION: 14 months

IGNITION INTERLOCK:  14 months

Victim Impact Panel on:  During period of probation.  If not available in Racine County, Defendant must attend in Waukesha County.  Defendant to serve 30 days huber, consecutive, as penalty for failure to attend Victim Impact Panel.

Other:  AODA ASSESSMENT AND FOLLOW THROUGH

with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Maxwell D Matter in court with Attorney Christopher Scott Carson.  Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Counts #1 & 2.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Counts #1 & 2.  Attorney Carson requests a later sentencing date.  Court adjourns sentencing.  Bail remains as fixed.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 25, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Wisconsin Community Service compliance letter received and filed.
Court received information from Wisconsin Community Services regarding defendant's compliance/non-compliance.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 03-28-2016 02:30 pm

Defendant Maxwell D Matter in court with Attorney Christopher Scott Carson.  Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case called for motion hearing.  Deputy Scott Poklasny is sworn-in and testifies.  Cross-examination by Attorney Carson.  Re-direct by the state.  Re-cross by Attorney Carson.  Deputy Robert Faith is sworn-in and testifies.  Cross-examination by Attorney Carson.  State rests.  No testimony by the defense.  Testimony is closed.  State gives closing arguments.  Attorney Carson makes closing statements.  Court denies motion to suppress for reasons stated on the record.  Attorney Carson requests a plea and sentencing date.    Bail remains as fixed.
Wisconsin Community Service compliance letter received and filed.
